message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.SE 

This paper discusses the development of protocols for private service discovery and authentication in the context of the Internet of Things (IoT) and mobile devices. The paper focuses on security and privacy concerns, which are typically addressed in the computer security (cs.CR) and networking and internet architecture (cs.NI) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the integration of the protocols into an existing open-source distributed applications framework, which falls under the systems and control (cs.SY) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the privacy limitations of the Apple AirDrop protocol, which is a peer-to-peer file sharing mechanism, and proposes a solution to improve its privacy, which falls under the distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC) and software engineering (cs.SE) sub-categories.
